page.title: 03FARMING - DAILY ROUTINE
page.content: In summer Mr Phillips gets up at 7 o'clock and has breakfast first. Mrs Phillips, Michael and Christopher have breakfast a little later and set off for school by car at 8.45pm. Mrs Phillips is a teacher and on a Thursday she would normally stay to help at Morley school and then have a piano lesson. She has no work to do on the farm. Mr Phillips will begin by feeding the cows and calves. In summer most of his work is preparation for harvest. The combine must be got ready and the bins cleaned to store the corn. He will check that the crops are healthy and stop for lunch at 12 noon. After lunch there will be hedgetrimming and general tidying up to be done. After school the boys help feed the calves and tea is at 5 o'clock. The evening might be spent pigeon scaring.
